Name: Pyramidion of Raia
Description: The four sides of the pyramidion bear representations in shallow sunk relief. The inscriptions are carved. The decorated parts are surrounded by simple carved lines. Each pair of opposite sides has an almost identical layout. On all four sides the solar bark is depicted at the top. Underneath this is a central column of inscription and two baboons facing each other or a kneeling man with inscriptions. All are praying. The pyramidion comes from the tomb of Raia at Saqqara and is very weathered in places.
